medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Acute onset of nausea and vomiting along with right lower quadrant abdominal pain. She went to the ED for evaluation and was discharged home after CT scan showed acute diverticulitis. Nausea has persisted despite nearly resolving abdominal pain, with inability to keep down food or drink since the previous admission. Mild headache noted, believed to be from not eating or drinking.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. History of migraine headaches, approximately 2 per month. 2. Iron deficiency anemia, presumed secondary to menses.
medical_history.family_history: Pancreatic cancer in father and dementia in other relatives.
